name: Man
line: This is a story from long ago, when the great mammoths still roamed our lands.

name: Man
line: The shaman woman of our village told us that these lights are the spirits of our ancestors, and that they have the power to make changes in our world. Small things become big.

name: Kenai
line: Never try to milk a caribou. [Laughs]

name: Sitka
line: Will you two knock it off?

name: Kenai
line: That's all right, Sitka. After today, he won't treat me like that anymore.

name: Denahi
line: Right. The big manhood ceremony. It doesn't matter what the spirits say. You'll always be our baby brother.

name: Kenai
line: Oh, yeah? Well, wait until I get my totem.

name: Sitka
line: Hey, I said knock it off. Now, the quicker we get these fish, the faster we're going to get to your ceremony, so let's all just try to get along for a few hours. OK, Denahi?

name: Kenai
line: So, what are we waiting for?

name: Tina Turner
line: [singing] ♪ When the earth was young, and the air was sweet, and the mountains kissed the sky. In the great beyond, with its many paths. Man and nature lived side by side. ♪

name: Child
line: Kenai's back! Are you excited about getting your spirit rock today?

name: Kenai
line: It's not a rock. It'll be my totem.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, I'll probably get, like, a saber-tooth tiger. For bravery or strength or greatness. You know, something that fits me.

name: Denahi
line: How about a mammoth for your fat head? Just make sure you get that basket tied up.

name: Kenai
line: Don't worry. No stupid bear is going to get anywhere near this fish.

name: Man
line: She's back! Hey, everybody, Tanana's back!

name: Child
line: Tanana's got your rock! Come on!

name: Tina Turner
line: [singing] ♪ Great Spirits of all who lived before. Take our hands. Take our hands and lead us. Fill our hearts. Fill our hearts and souls with all you know. You know, you can show. Show us that in your eyes, we are all the same. Brothers to each other, in this world, we remain. Truly brothers all the same. Brothers all the same! ♪

name: Tanana
line: Well, hello there, sweetheart. What a big girl.

name: Tanana
line: When each of us comes of age, the great spirits reveal to us a totem that helps guide us through our lives. Some of us use courage to guide us.

name: Tanana
line: Others, patience. And some of us, beauty. Kenai. You nervous?

name: Tanana
line: [Giggles] Ooh, you should be. It's a good one. Kenai, I have been to the mountain, where the lights touch the earth, and the great spirits have realvealed to me your totem. To become a man, your actions must be guided by one thing. Your totem is... Love.

name: Tanana
line: A love that connects and unites all living things.

name: Tanana
line: There is no trading. Oh, Kenai, love is the most precious of totems. It reveals itself in unexpected ways. Let love guide your actions. Then one day, you'll be a man, and will place your mark next to those of our ancestors.

name: Denahi
line: There he is. Come here, lover boy.

name: Denahi
line: Your totem: I think it's really great.

name: Denahi
line: Yeah. And I made you something.

name: Denahi
line: Now when you skip around loving everybody, you'll smell so sweet.

name: Sitka
line: Well, isn't this nice? Instead of fighting, you're giving each other flowers.

name: Denahi
line: Yeah, isn't it lovely? He's so in touch with his totem already.

name: Sitka
line: Hey, dog breath, go take care of the fish.

name: Denahi
line: Sure. Kenai loves me, he loves me not.

name: Kenai
line: Someday, I'm going to just... He's just such a...

name: Sitka
line: Hey, bonehead. Just because his totem is wisdom, doesn't mean he's wise. I mean, look at him.

name: Denahi
line: Kenai love me, he loves me not.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, I guess the spirits messed up on both of our totems.

name: Sitka
line: You know, I felt the same way when Tanana give me mine.

name: Sitka
line: No, really. I said, "The eagle of guidance?" What does that mean? But now that I'm older, I know it's about being a leader, and keeping an eye on you two.

name: Kenai
line: I just want to get my handprint on that wall.

name: Sitka
line: Just be patient, Kenai. When you live by your totem, you will.

name: Kenai
line: [Chuckles] But, come on. The bear of love? I mean, a bear doesn't love anyone. They don't think. They don't feel. I mean, they're...

name: Denahi
line: You didn't tie it up, did you?

name: Denahi
line: You should've got the totem of pinheads.

name: Sitka
line: Knock it off. We'll just make another basket.

name: Denahi
line: We? Oh, no. It took me two weeks to make that basket. You get lover boy to do it. He's the one that's messing things up all the time. Typical Kenai.

name: Kenai
line: All right. I'll go get your basket.

name: Denahi
line: If we're lucky, far away. Huh.

name: Kenai
line: Sitka, no! You got to get out of here!

name: Denahi
line: Hey, bear, come on! Over here! Come on, bear! Come this way!

name: Kenai
line: Come on! Sitka! Where are you?

name: Kenai
line: No. Sitka! Denahi let's find you! Where are you?

name: Denahi
line: I know what you're feeling, but killing that bear is wrong.

name: Kenai
line: Wrong? Our brother is dead, and it's because of that monster.

name: Denahi
line: I don't blame the bear, Kenai.

name: Denahi
line: Killing that bear won't make you a man.

name: Kenai
line: Now you're trying to be wise.

name: Denahi
line: I'm trying to follow my totem. Why can't you do the same?

name: Kenai
line: You really think love has anything to do with being a man? A man wouldn't just sit here and do nothing.

name: Tanana
line: You left too soon, Sitka. Your brothers need your guidance.

name: Denahi
line: I don't blame the bear, Kenai.

name: Kenai
line: A man wouldn't just sit here and do nothing.

name: Tanana
line: So, Kenai, you've decided to join the living. That's quite a bump you've got there. That must've been one heck of a ride down those rapids, huh?

name: Kenai
line: Tanana? [Moaning] Ooh. [Gasps] Nana, you won't believe this. I was at the top of this huge rock... and all of a sudden, this.... [Grunting and growling]

name: Tanana
line: Kenai, honey. Shh-shh-shh. I don't speak bear.

name: Tanana
line: All right, all right. Will you settle down? Kenai! This isn't going to work. [Sighs] Kenai, listen to me. Sitka did this. Hmm. Strange. Spirits don't usually make these kind of changes. Oh, my. Sitka must have something really big planned for you. Yep, yep. You're going to get a whole new perspective on things. Oh! Do you see in black and white or color? Hey, listen to me. You got yourself into this mess. If you want to change, take it up with your brother's spirit. You'll find him on the mountain, where the lights touch the earth. He'll help you make up for what you've done wrong.

name: Kenai
line: But I didn't do anything wrong. Tanana? Wait! I didn't do anything wrong! I don't even know how to get there.

name: Kenai
line: Hey, wait! Come back! I'm trying to find where the lights--

name: Tuke
line: What's he getting all worked up about, eh?

name: Rutt
line: Gee, I don't know. Maybe the gulls popped on him, eh?

name: Tuke
line: Oh, gee, I think he's looking over here. Let's beat it. This way.

name: Rutt
line: Oh, gee, I think he's seen us, eh. Now what?

name: Tuke
line: Shh! What are you doing, eh?

name: Rutt
line: You wouldn't like us. We're really gamy.

name: Rutt
line: You went too far that time.

name: Rutt
line: Besides, yours is bigger than mine.

name: Tuke
line: Oh, whew! That's mighty decent of you, eh.

name: Rutt
line: Yeah. Hey, my name's Rutt. This is my brother, Tuke.

name: Kenai
line: No, I mean, I'm not a bear. I hate bears.

name: Rutt
line: Well, gee, eh? You're one big beaver.

name: Kenai
line: Do either of you know where the lights touch the earth?

name: Rutt
line: Yee...ahh... No. Uh, no. Sorry, bear. Or beaver.

name: Kenai
line: I'm not a beaver. I'm a bear. No, I mean, I'm not a bear. I'm a man.

name: Kenai
line: I was transformed into a bear magically. I was lifted into the sky by my brother.

name: Tuke
line: [Coughing] No! That bear over there! He's crazy!

name: Tuke
line: Well, who ever said you were? We understand.

name: Tuke
line: Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah, you see, we're not moose, either.

name: Tuke
line: No. Heh. We're lime... We're like squirrels. Yeah.

name: Rutt
line: Oh. Oh, yeah. Beauty, eh? Well, he's actually the squirrel, eh? I'm more of a pure-bred wolverine. Look at these cuspids! [Growls]

name: Kenai
line: Ugh! Why am I even talking to a couple of dumb moose?

name: Rutt
line: Oh, I wouldn't go that way.

name: Rutt
line: I'm trying to, but you're talking...

name: Tuke
line: So, you think of it yet?

name: Rutt
line: Well, no, but it's driving me nuts too?

name: Koda
line: Psst. Hey. Is the coast clear?

name: Koda
line: Oh, good! How you doing? Guess you didn't see the trap, huh? I saw it from a mile away. You must be pretty embarrassed. Don't worry. [Whispers] I won't tell anyone.

name: Koda
line: You need to get down. Let me help.

name: Kenai
line: No, just! Stop that! If you just.... Give me... Stop it!

name: Koda
line: It's no use. The only way to get down is to chew your own foot off.

name: Kenai
line: I don't need some stupid bear's help. I just need the stick.

name: Kenai
line: No. I'll do it myself. Put it back. No, where you found it.

name: Kenai
line: To the left. By the little rock.

name: Koda
line: OK. Boy, that tree is strong, huh? You know, when I was little, I was really into climbing trees, all kinds of trees. I climed pine trees, oak trees, fig trees, maple trees, birch trees, willow trees... My eyes were watering, and my tongue was swollen, and from that moment on, I was more careful about what I lick.

name: Kenai
line: [Straining] Ha! See? It's all about, using your head. Oh!

name: Koda
line: Ooh! That was funny! Do it again!

name: Kenai
line: Don't you have someplace to go?

name: Koda
line: Yeah, the salmon run. How about this? I get you down, then we go together. Deal?

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, OK, fine. If you can magically get me down, I'll go with you to this...

name: Kenai
line: Whatever. But if you can't, you turn around, walk away, and never come back ever.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, sure, fine. Pinky swear. But this is a human trap, and you're just a dumb little bear. So there's really no way you're gonna be able to... [Gasping] Aagghh!

name: Koda
line: OK, so what I'm thinking is, we travel by day and sleep by night. My bedtime is an hour after sunset. Or I think... [Sniffs] Run!

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, good riddance! [Sniffing] Denahi, you found me! [Roaring] You wouldn't believe what a nightmare this has been! Denahi? It me, Kenai!

name: Koda
line: Is he gone? I think he was going...

name: Koda
line: Yeah, well, lucky for him he didn't find us, 'cause when I get into a fight, I go all crazy, and I'm a raging ball with brown fur. [Grunts]

name: Koda
line: I mean, I don't want to brag or nothing, but I got some moves.

name: Koda
line: Yep. This first one... Well, it's just a little thing, I like to call, "The Slasher"! And this one I like to call "Flying Fury of Death"!

name: Koda
line: Yeah, well, the next time we run into that hunter--

name: Kenai
line: There is no "we," OK? I'm not taking you to any salmon run.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, well, things change. See ya, kid.

name: Koda
line: Wait. The truth is, I got separated from my mom, and now with this hunter around...

name: Kenai
line: Kid, I got my own problems.

name: Koda
line: Come on. Please? Can't we just go together? There's a lot of bears and a ton of fish, and every night we watch the lights, touch the mountain, and last year...

name: Koda
line: There's lots of bears and tons of fish.

name: Kenai
line: No. You know where the lights touch the earth?

name: Koda
line: Yeah, it's at the top of the mountain right by the salmon run.

name: Koda
line: No, no. They're pratically next door. Come on, I'll show you. It'll be great. I promise to help you escape from every trap you walk into.

name: Kenai
line: I'm not gonna walk into any more... Traps.

name: Koda
line: Come on. What do you say?

name: Kenai
line: You're sure you can take me to where the lights touch the earth?

name: Kenai
line: All right. We leave the first thing tomorrow. And keep all that cuddly bear stuff into a minimum, OK, kid?

name: Koda
line: My name's not kid. It's Koda. What's your name?

name: Tuke
line: Beauty. So, we got a lot to get done today. You want to get started?

name: Rutt
line: Yeah, just give me one sec?

name: Rutt
line: [Inhaling] Woo-oo-hoo... Could you just help me crack this?

name: Rutt
line: [Exhaling] Just want to do, dog facing foward.

name: Tuke
line: And go This is a nice patch here.

name: Rutt
line: Oh, gee. Don't go near this patch here. Something went here.

name: Kenai
line: Hey, I've got a mountain to get to. Come on, kid.

name: Koda
line: I told you before, my name's Koda. Say it with me. Ko...Da.

name: Kenai
line: Sure your mom didn't ditch you, Ko...duh?

name: Rutt
line: Go away? I'm eating twigs. You're breaking my concentration?

name: Rutt
line: I can't. I'm still digesting? I'll get cramps. Whoa, gee! He's after us!

name: Koda
line: Actually, if you really want to know, how me and my mom got separated, I was saving this story for the salmon run, but I'll tell you. It was propbably the fifth of sixth most coldest day in my entire life.

name: Kenai
line: Oh, this sounds good. You should definitley save it.

name: Koda
line: Well, I have this other story...

name: Kenai
line: Tell you what. How about no talking?

name: Koda
line: [singing] ♪ Tell everybody I'm on my way. ♪

name: Koda
line: ♪ New friends and new places to see. ♪

name: Kenai
line: Come on, quit it. Shh! Koda, stop singing.

name: Koda
line: ♪ With... [Muffled] Yes, I'm on my way. And there's nowhere else that I'd rather be. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ Tell everybody I'm on my way. And I'm loving every step I take. With the sun beating down, yes I'm on my way. And I can't keep this smile off my face. Cause there's nothing like seeing each other again. No matter what the distance between. And the stories that will tell, will make you smile. Oh, it really lifts my heart. So tell 'em all I'm on my way. New friends and new places to see. And to sleep under the stars, who could ask for more? With the moon keeping watch over me? Not the snow not the rain, can change my mind. The sun will come out, wait and see. And the feeling of the wind of your face can lift your heart. Oh, there's nowhere I'd rather be. ♪ Cause I'm on my way now. ♪ Well and truly. ♪ I'm on my way now. ♪

name: Rutt
line: Hold on! Wait up. How's it going, bear boy?

name: Rutt
line: Gee, I didn't know you had a little brother. He's cute, eh?

name: Rutt
line: OK, there's this hunter, following us, and I was-- we was thinking. If we could maybe nust kind of hang out with you guys...

name: Tuke
line: Yeah, just hang out. That's right.

name: Rutt
line: Yeah. It'd be fun, you know? I mean, if the hunter who's going to catch up-- and-- and--

name: Rutt
line: Right. Well, that's what we was thinking.

name: Kenai
line: We lost the hunter back under the glacier.

name: Rutt
line: So, you don't think he'll follow those?

name: Rutt
line: When can I have a turn, eh?

name: Tuke
line: It's not as easy as it looks. Now just watch what I do, OK?

name: Rutt
line: Well, let's get a backseat or something. I look like you hunted me. Oh.

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ Tell everybody. Tell everybody I'm on my way. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ I'm on my way. And I just can't wait to be there. I'm on my way. ♪ Just can't wait to be there. With blue skies ahead, yes I'm on my way. And nothing but good times to share. So tell everybody I'm on my way, and I just can't wait to be home. Just can't wait to be home. With the sun beating down, yes I'm on my way. And nothing but good times to show. I'm on my way. ♪

name: Koda
line: OK, here's how I remember it. If the snow is white, then it's all right. Yellow or green, it's just not clean. I learned that one the hard way. Oh, that reminds me. Last year at the salmon run, my friend Bucky totally dared me, but I'd heard about this other cub who stuck his tongue to an iceberg, and then he started to float away. And so to save him, they had to, like, rip off his tongue. And so now he has to talk, like this all the time and...

name: Koda
line: Whoa, look. The night rainbow. You can see the spirits from here.

name: Kenai
line: You know about the great spirits?

name: Koda
line: Yeah. My grandma's up there and my granddad. Mom says the spirits, make all the magical changes of the world, like how the leaves change color, or the moon changes shapes or tadpoles change into frogs.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, I get. You know, for a change, maybe they could just leave things alone.

name: Kenai
line: My brother's a spirit. If I wasn't for him, I wouldn't be here.

name: Koda
line: You have a brother up there? What happened to him?

name: Kenai
line: He was killed by a by a monster.

name: Koda
line: Thanks, Sitka. If it weren't for you, I would've never met Kenai. I always wanted a brother.

name: Rutt
line: So, you want to play I spy?

name: Rutt
line: Tree? OK, I spy something uh, a vertical log.

name: Kenai
line: So, where are we? Well, which way?

name: Kenai
line: Why wasn't I turned into a homing pigeon? Come on.

name: Koda
line: Hey, riding mammoths was your idea. Thanks for the ride, guys. See you. Lucky for you I've been lost worse than this before. Last summer, I was digging for roots with Buck...

name: Kenai
line: Enough with the stories. I don't care about the time you and Binky found, you know, the world's biggest pine cone ever.

name: Koda
line: First of all, his name's Bucky, not Binky. Second, it wasn't a pine cone. It was a pine nut, and it was huge, even bigger than your fat head.

name: Rutt
line: Oh, gee, our big guardian bear is leaving, eh?

name: Tuke
line: Yeah, yeah, we better follow. Come on.

name: Rutt
line: Me, neither. OK, you guys! I guess we'll just catch up with those guys later?

name: Rutt
line: Beauty. You know, I was thinking. Now might be a really good time, for me to drive, eh?

name: Tuke
line: Just relax and enjoy the ride.

name: Koda
line: I'm sorry we're lost, OK? Even though it's pretty much your fault.

name: Koda
line: Just remember, if it weren't for me, you'd still be hanging upside down right now.

name: Kenai
line: Yeah, well, better than being stuck, in the middle of nowhere with you and your blabbering mouth. [Mockingly] "I'm lost. I can't find my mommy. Will you take me to the salmon run?" Why don't you just grow up?

name: Koda
line: Fine. I'll just go on my own, then.

name: Koda
line: Those monsters are really scary. Especially with those sticks.

name: Kenai
line: Come on. Let's go. So, you recognize anything yet? Or maybe you can't see past my fat head.

name: Kenai
line: So, do you really think I have a fat head?

name: Koda
line: Well, if you hunched your shoulders a little, it wouldn't seem so big.

name: Kenai
line: Oh, you mean like this? Or like this? How about this?

name: Koda
line: Hey, maybe they can give us directions.

name: Koda
line: I think their horns are screwed on too tight. Wait a second. I know this place.

name: Koda
line: Yeah. The salmon run's not far.

name: Koda
line: We just have to go through here. What?

name: Kenai
line: Hey, you sure you know where you're going?

name: Kenai
line: There's scared, and then there's surprised.

name: Koda
line: And you were both. Nice try. Uh, you got a little spit right there. [Gasps] Kenai!

name: Kenai
line: [Chuckling] You're not getting me this time.

name: Koda
line: Kenai, where are you? Left! No, the other left!

name: Koda
line: What are you doing? We got to get out of here!

name: Koda
line: Why do they hate us, Kenai?

name: Kenai
line: So, you know how they are. They're killers.

name: Koda
line: Wait a minute. Who's the killers?

name: Koda
line: What? Which bears? I'm not like that, and you're not like that.

name: Kenai
line: Well, obviously not all bears. I mean, you're OK, but most bears will look for any excuse to attack the human.

name: Kenai
line: You know, you're just a cub. When you're older, you'll understand.

name: Koda
line: We made it! We're here! Come on!

name: Kenai
line: Get away from me! Go on. Shoo!

name: Tug
line: Yeah. Try not to scare off the fish there, buddy.

name: Koda
line: Look at you. Tug, have you see my mom yet?

name: Tug
line: No, as a matter of fact, I haven't seen her.

name: Koda
line: Me and my friend Kenai beat her.

name: Tug
line: Huh. I've never seen you at the run before. Where are you from?

name: Koda
line: And see, Kenai? There's the mountain, just like I promised. The lights touch the top every single night. It's going to be a lot harder getting up there, than it was riding those mammoths.

name: Koda
line: Yeah. He does a lot of weird stuff, like the way he drinks water with a leaf. He never sharpens his claws on a tree. He's never hibernated before.

name: Kenai
line: Koda. Koda! [Clears throat] Can I talk to you for a second. Excuse us.

name: Tug
line: Hmm. He's kind of jumpy, isn't he?

name: Kenai
line: OK, OK. Koda, I, uh... I got to get going.

name: Koda
line: Well, when you come back, we can go and...

name: Kenai
line: I.. I won't be coming back.

name: Kenai
line: Because... Well, it's hard to explain.

name: Kenai
line: No [Stammering] Well, I mean, yes. Well, it's just that I... I don't belong here.

name: Tug
line: Don't belong? Every bear belongs here. Come on, buddy. Let's have some fun.

name: Blind Boys of Alabama
line: [singing] ♪ Everyone's invited, this is how we live. We're all here for each other happy to give. ♪ All we have we share, and all of us we care, so come on! Welcome to our family time. Welcome to our brotherly time. We're happy giving and taking to the friends we're making. There's nothing we won't do. Welcome to our family time. Welcome to our happy to be time. This is our festival. You know and best of all, we're here to share it all. There's a bond between us, nobody can explain. It's a celebration of life, and seeing friends again. I'd be there for you, I know you'd be there for me too. So come on! Welcome to our family time. Welcome to our brotherly time. This is our festival. You and best of all, we're here to share it all. Remembering love once departed someone dear to your heart. Finding love, and planning a future. Telling stories and laughing with friends. Precious moments you'll never forget. This has to be the most beautiful the most peaceful place I've ever been to. It's nothing like I've ever seen before. When I think of how far I've come, I can't believe it, and yet I see it. In them I see family I see the way we used to be. Come on! Welcome to our family time. Welcome to our brotherly timw. We're happy giving and taking to the friends we're making, there's nothing we won't do. Welcome to our family time. Welcome to our happy to be time. This is our festival. You know and best of all. We're here to share it all. We're here to share it all! ♪

name: Tug
line: All right. Settle down, everyone. Hey! Don't throw your fish bones over there. Somebody could choke on that. Look, OK, I'll go first. OK, let's see. The most interesting thing that happened to me this year. Hmm. [Mutters] Oh, I know. Listen to this. I'd say it was when I finally knocked down that tree... that was blocking the view from my cave. Now I got a family of chipmunks staying at my place. [Clears thorat] Yeah. All right, everybody, come on, let me see some paws in the air. Who's going to be next? Come on.

name: Tug
line: Watch me, watch me. Hey, got you.

name: Koda
line: This is it. I got it!

name: Edgar
line: I told you, woman! I'm right here!

name: Koda
line: This has got to be it.

name: Koda
line: You got to tell it, Kenai.

name: Tug
line: That's right, Kenai. You caught it, you tell it.

name: Koda
line: Didn't you play this game when you were a cub?

name: Kenai
line: OK, all right, already, all right. You want to know what I did this year?

name: Kenai
line: I went on the longest, hardest, most exhausting journey I've ever been on, with the biggest pain in the neck I've ever met. What do you expect from a little brother? OK, buddy, your turn.

name: Koda
line: OK, OK. Here we go. [Clears throat] This year I watched my mom in a life-and-death struggle, against all odds battling possibly, the most fiercest creature on the face of the earth. OK, who's next?

name: Tug
line: Wait a minute. I think we all want to hear the rest of that one, Koda.

name: Koda
line: I thought you might say that. Let's see. It was probably the fifth or sixth most coldest day, in my entire life. Me and mom were eating fish, having a great time, when all of a sudden, she pushes me into the bushes, and tells me to be real quiet. She says, "I smell something," so I started sniffing. There was something in the woods, running right toward us, getting closer and closer.

name: Koda
line: And then, out of the trees, jumps the hunter!

name: Koda
line: And now there's nowhere for mama to go. The monster has her backed up against this giant glacier! The monster attacks! But mom's too quick for him. And before he can do it again, she stands up real big and yells, "Go away!"

name: Koda
line: Then mom smells more of 'em. There's a whole pack coming right at us!

name: Koda
line: She runs out to stop them, before they can get to me. And all around they're poking her with sticks. The whole thing broke, and they fell into the water. There was ice everywhere! She couldn't hold her breath any longer before, pow! She burst out of the water. I've never been so scared in my life.

name: Kenai
line: Sitka's not here, because of that monster.

name: Tug
line: Whoa! Fell off a glacier? I've never see anything like that. Can you imagine?

name: Tug
line: Hey, Kenai, what's wrong? Where you going?

name: Koda
line: She got out of the water OK, but that's how we got separated. Right after that, I met Kenai?

name: Koda
line: Where have you been? You look horrible.

name: Kenai
line: Koda. My mom says when you eat too much fish, you should just lie down...

name: Kenai
line: There's something I, you know that story you told me last night?

name: Kenai
line: Well, I have a story to tell you.

name: Kenai
line: Well, it's kind of about a man, and kind of about a bear. But mostly it's about a monster, a monster who did something so bad...

name: Phil Collins
line: [singing] ♪ Everywhere I turn, I hurt someone. But there's nothing I can say to change the things I've done. I do anything within my power, I give everything I got. But the path I seek is hidden from me now. ♪

name: Kenai
line: Koda, I did something very wrong.

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ Brother Bear, I let you down. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ You trusted me, believed in me, and I let you down. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ Of all the things I hid from you, I cannot hide the shame. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ And I pray someone, something will come. ♪

name: Phil Collins
line: ♪ To take away the pain. There's no way out of this dark place. No hope, no future. I know I can't be free. But I can't see another way. And I can't face another day. ♪

name: Kenai
line: Koda! Koda, I wish I could... If there was just some way... I'd give anything if, I could just... [Sighs] I'm sorry, Koda. I'm so sorry.

name: Denahi
line: I'm sorry, Kenai. I don't know what I'm doing anymore. I need help.

name: Rutt
line: If I was driving, this never would've happened.

name: Rutt
line: You ever let me drive, you never let me do nothing.

name: Tuke
line: Trample off? I said I was sorry. Let it go.

name: Rutt
line: I can't believe you totalled a mammoth.

name: Tuke
line: Come on. That mountain came out of nowhere.

name: Rutt
line: I'm afraid I cannot accept your apology.

name: Tuke
line: It was in my blind spot.

name: Rutt
line: It's that little cub. Gee, something's bugging him.

name: Rutt
line: Good. Now, where were we? You're a big selfish, reckless hoofer, and you're never gonna change.

name: Rutt
line: I'm fed up with it? From now on, he's my new brother.

name: Rutt
line: Sorry, you've been replaced with my dear brother... I forget your name. What's your name again, little bear?

name: Koda
line: I don't want any more brothers.

name: Rutt
line: See, he's had enough of you?

name: Tuke
line: Come on. I promise I'll change.

name: Rutt
line: Trample off. You'll never change. Being a brother means nothing to you.

name: Tuke
line: What about the time your hooves froze in the pond? Who sat with you all winter, eh?

name: Tuke
line: And who showed you where the good grazing is? I mean the really tender stuff, all covered in dew?

name: Rutt
line: Now, why do you think I did that?

name: Rutt
line: Excuse me? I don't believe I heard what you said.

name: Rutt
line: Hey! Not there, that's the spot. [Laughing]

name: Tuke
line: Like, we'll see you later, smallish bear.

name: Rutt
line: Yeah. Good day. Hey, you know what this calls for? A pile of delicious barley and amber weed on a cool bed of malted hops?

name: Kenai
line: Sitka! Sitka, are you there? Sitka! Please. Please, Sitka. I don't knw what else to do. Sitka? Denahi.

name: Kenai
line: Sitka, hurry! Change me back! Where are you, Sitka?

name: Kenai
line: No! Leave him alone! Koda! [Shouting and echoing]

name: Kenai
line: Koda, don't be afraid. It's me.

name: Denahi
line: You know, he did look better as a bear.

name: Sitka
line: No matter what you choose, you'll always be my little brother.

name: Man
line: My brother Kenai, went to live with Koda and the other bears. He taught me that love is very powerful. And, I passed on the wisdom of his story, to our people: The story of a boy who became a man, by becoming a bear.

name: Tina Turner
line: [singing] ♪ Great Spirits of all who lived before. Take our hands. Take our hands and lead us. Fill our hearts. Fill our hearts souls with all you know. You know, you can show. Show us that in your eyes, we are all the same. Brothers to each other. In this world, we remain, truly brothers all the same. Brothers all the same! ♪

name: Rutt
line: So, like uh, what are doing there, smallish bear?

name: Koda
line: I'm practicing my moves. Want to see one?

name: Rutt
line: Sure, this ought to be good, eh?

name: Kenai
line: Listen to me. I was a man that was changed into a bear. No beaver. Man into bear. That's it.

name: Rutt
line: Oh, yeah. So, before that you was probably, like, a goat?

name: Tuke
line: Hey, bow about a water buffalo?

name: Rutt
line: No, he's a rabbit. Look at his ears and his furry little feet. Watch out for the rabbit.

name: Rutt
line: OK, now, everyone. [Inhales] Take a big inhale? And then on the exhale... [Exhales] Shift into salutation to the sun.

name: Kenai
line: [Chuckles] How you doing over there, Koda?

name: Koda
line: [Clears throat] In the accordance with all federal and state wildlife regulations, no fish were harmed during in the making of this film.

name: Fish
line: [Shouting and laughing] No! He's gonna eat me! [Shrieking]
